business.headline: Why family offices are crucial to India's 'Viksit Bharat by 2047' dream?At the India Today Conclave 2025, Rishabh Shroff, Partner at Cyril Amarchand Mangaldas, discussed the growing role of family offices in India's journey towards becoming a developed economy by 2047. In a session titled "A Case for Tomorrow", moderated by Siddharth Zarabi, Shroff explained why family offices are vital for India's economic expansion and how they can contribute to achieving a Rs 30 trillion GDP target in the coming decades.

US Gold Card visa expensive, not worth it for Indians: Top law firm bossRishabh Shroff, partner at Cyril Amarchand Mangaldas, said Donald Trump's $5 million US Gold Card visa does not make sense for Indians as cheaper alternatives are available.

Why are the richest 1% leaving India? Law firm boss Rishabh Shroff explains Rishabh Shroff, Partner at Cyril Amarchand Mangaldas, shared insights into the rising trend of high-net-worth individuals (HNWIs) acquiring foreign passports and moving their wealth abroad.

Pay is based on capability, not gender: Avarna Jain on pay gap in music industryAt the India Today Conclave 2025, Avarna Jain, Vice Chairperson of Saregama, spoke about the role of women in the workforce and addressed the long-debated issue of pay parity in the music and entertainment industry. She stated that in creative fields, women are leading the way, and pay is determined by ability and capability, not gender.

Place of TV will never be taken away: Anu Ranjan on OTTs replacing TVAnu Ranjan, President of The Indian Television Academy, said that television will remain relevant despite the rise of OTT platforms at the India Today Conclave 2025. She explained that while digital streaming services are growing, they cannot replace television, mainly due to affordability and accessibility.

Conclave 2025: Women leaders on breaking barriers, challenges and leadershipAt the India Today Conclave 2025, Namita Thapar, Executive Director of Emcure Pharmaceuticals, stated that businesses should be evaluated based on numbers, not gender. Speaking at the session "Breaking Barriers and Building Legacies," Thapar stressed that success in business depends on financial results, not whether a man or woman runs it.

Dalal Street logs best week of 2025. Will positive momentum continue?After a long spell of selling, investors on Dalal Street have finally got some relief. But does this mean the worst is over? Here is all you need to know.

Businesses should be judged by numbers, not gender: Namita Thapar International Women's Day: Namita Thapar, Executive Director of Emcure Pharmaceuticals, highlighted how financial results remain the key factor in business success, regardless of whether a man or a woman runs the company.

Women investors outpacing men in mutual fund investments: ReportThere's a common belief that women prefer safer investments, but the data challenges that view. More women are actively investing in mutual funds and surpassing men in key areas.

These 3 money deadlines you can't miss in March 2025If you want to secure better returns, deposit in these special fixed deposits, which are available only for a limited period. The last date for investing in these schemes is March 31, 2025.

Bengaluru's housing rent crisis triggers online debate. Details hereA recent social media post has ignited debate over Bengaluru's soaring rents, with users sharing how housing costs are outpacing salaries and making city living unaffordable.

ad:tech New Delhi unveils ad:techHonours to recognise marketing tech innovationHeld on March 6 at Yashobhoomi, in collaboration with the International Advertising Association (IAA) India Chapter, this event brought together industry leaders to honour the innovators shaping the future of tech-driven marketing.

entertainment.headline: Lollapalooza India Day 1: Shawn Mendes must return for a solo concert in IndiaThe first day of Lollapalooza India 2025 kicked off on a grand note with Canadian singer Shawn Mendes' electrifying performance. The show also witnessed performances by several Indian artists, like Jonita Gandhi and Divine among others.

Shawn Mendes honours Virat Kohli, wears Team India jersey at Mumbai show. WatchSinger Shawn Mendes impressed fans with his debut India performance on March 8 at the Lollapalooza Mumbai show. During the concert, the singer delighted fans by wearing Virat Kohli's Team India jersey.

Viral: Shawn Mendes sings Senorita on Mumbai street ahead of concertCanadian singer Shawn Mendes, who is currently in India, performed his hit song Senorita on a Mumbai street on Saturday, much to the delight of his fans.
Zahan Kapoor on legacy, Black Warrant, and carving his own path. Watch

Zahan Kapoor reflects on celebrityhood, Kapoor legacy and Black Warrant's successActor Zahan Kapoor opened up about his career, his latest Netflix show, Black Warrant, his famous cousins, and more, at the India Today Conclave 2025 held in New Delhi on Saturday.

Mindy Kaling reacts to criticism of Meghan Markle's With Love, MeghanActor and creator Mindy Kaling has finally reacted to the criticism of Meghan Markle's lifestyle series, With Love, Meghan. The show premiered on Netflix on March 4.

The Electric State review: Russo Brothers' dystopian film sparks and fizzles outReleased-Fri Mar 14, 2025The Netflix film, 'The Electric State' falls short of entertainment. The chemistry between Millie Bobbie Brown and Chris Pratt looks awkward, while the bots don't do enough to keep the excitement alive.

Nadaaniyan X reviews: Internet shreds Ibrahim-Khushi's film, calls it trashyNadaaniyan, starring Ibrahim Ali Khan and Khushi Kapoor, debuts on Netflix to widespread criticism, with viewers and critics alike branding it 'unbearable' and 'trashy'.

Ruby review: A debut album that's ambitious, polished, and unapologetically Jennie Blackpink's Jennie's debut solo album, Ruby, is a bold exploration of her musical identity, featuring 15 tracks that delve into themes of empowerment and self-discovery.

Meghan Markle's With Love, Meghan renewed for season 2 amid criticismThe Duchess of Sussex, Meghan Markle, has announced a second season of her Netflix series, With Love, Meghan. The show premiered on the OTT giant on March 4.

BB OTT 3 fame Kritika-Armaan Malik's son Zaid diagnosed with ricketsBigg Boss OTT 3 fame Kritika Malik and husband Armaan Malik's son, Zaid has been diagnosed with rickets. The news was shared by Armaan's first wife, Payal Malik, in her latest vlog.

Neena Gupta's 'Phulera Ka Panchayati Raj' exposes proxy politics in rural IndiaTVF's new series 'Phulera Ka Panchayati Raj' exposed the problem of proxy politics in rural India. In collaboration with the popular series, Panchayat, the series starring Neena Gupta, Faisal Malik, and others is currently trending at No 1 on YouTube.

Pritam defends Blackpink's Jennie amid plagiarism row: Minor similarities happenMusic composer Pritam recently shared a statement and defended Blackpink's Jennie amid plagiarism claims after her recently released teaser looked similar to Alia Bhatt's theme song from Rocky Aur Rani Kii Prem Kahaani.

Mobland trailer: Tom Hardy, Pierce Brosnan headline Guy Ritchie's new crime showMobland, the much-awaited crime series by Guy Ritchie, is all set for its grand premiere on JioHotstar this March. Featuring stars like Tom Hardy and Helen Mirren, the show explores the dark world of international crime syndicates.

Rishab Sharma on popularising Sitar, starting his own clothing brandRenowned 26-year-old sitar player Rishab Rikhiram Sharma blends classical and modern music. Trained under Ravi Shankar, he performs globally, including at the White House. Known for his mehendi-adorned hands, he also creates music for mental health.

What Rick Hoffman's entry as Louis Litt means for Suits LAActor Rick Hoffman will be reprising his iconic character, Louis Litt, from 'Suits', in one of the upcoming episodes of 'Suits LA'. The news comes days after the show received bad reviews for lacking excitement like the original one.

Why sitarist Rishab Sharma wears mehndi for every performanceSitarist Rishab Sharma embraces mehndi as part of his stage presence, blending tradition with innovation. The young sitarist shares how he enhances performance aesthetics while breaking stereotypes.

Sitarist Rishab Sharma: Said no to performing at White House initiallyRenowned sitarist and internet sensation Rishab Sharma opened up about performing at the White House, choosing the sitar over guitar, and more, during his appearance at India Today Conclave 2025 in New Delhi on Friday.

Shabana Azmi says Shibani Akhtar 'pulled her by the ear' to join Dabba CartelShabana Azmi revealed at the India Today Conclave 2025 that Shibani Akhtar "pulled her by the ear" to make her join Dabba Cartel. Shibani always envisioned her as part of the series.

Shabana Azmi on Dabba Cartel, rise of OTT, and feminism in cinema. VideoAt the India Today Conclave 2025, Shabana Azmi spoke about her role in Dabba Cartel, emphasising that 'power can be quiet'. Co-creator Shibani Akhtar revealed that the concept was built around the idea of a "Shabana Azmi drug cartel" from the outset. The series presents a compelling narrative of women coming together in solidarity within a crime drama, with Azmi's nuanced and quiet yet powerful performance serving as its anchor. Her portrayal marks a significant thematic shift in Indian storytelling. Jyotika also shared her experience and connection to her character, highlighting how the roles reflect real-life struggles faced by women, as well as themes of feminism and women's emancipation.

Jyotika on working with Shabana Azmi in Dabba Cartel: She was a friend to usActor Jyotika was recently seen in the newly-released show Dabba Cartel. At India Today Conclave 2025, she spoke about her character in the crime drama, her camaraderie with Shabana Azmi and what drew her to Dabba Cartel.

Shabana Azmi, Jyotika and Shibani Dandekar open up about making Dabba Cartel. PicsDabba Cartel actors Shabana Azmi, Jyotika and creator Shibani Dandekar graced the India Today Conclave 2025 on Friday, where they shared their experience of creating the Netflix series.

BTS J-hope's Sweet Dreams is a sensuous song brought alive by Miguel's vocalsBTS member J-hope has released a new song called Sweet Dreams, which also features the American artiste Miguel. Check out the music video inside.

Dupahiya review: A wholesome watch for your next relaxed weekendReleased-Fri Mar 07, 2025Dupahiya review: This Prime Video series is a charming small-town comedy with endearing performances, witty dialogues, and social themes. While it drags at times, its humour and heart make it a delightful, easy watch.

Unpopular opinion: Korean star Lee Min-ho is overratedSouth Korean star Lee Min-ho is a beloved actor. But he is certainly not the most talented or versatile artiste out there. Min-ho is currently seen in the show, When the Stars Gossip, which is streaming on Netflix.

The Waking of a Nation review: Ram Madhvani's sincere attempt leaves little impactReleased-Thu Mar 06, 2025The Waking of a Nation review: Director Ram Madhvani's show explores the Jallianwala Bagh Massacre over six episodes. The show is streaming on SonyLIV.

Singer Shawn Mendes shops in Mumbai's Colaba, goes unnoticed by fansSinger Shawn Mendes has arrived in Mumbai to perform at the Lollapalooza. His casual shopping spree in a vest and flip-flops has caught fans' attention.

Friends actor recalls 'toxic environment' on set: I had become so race-consciousActor Stephen Park shared his negative experiences on the set of Friends, highlighting racial insensitivity. He recalled an incident involving an assistant director's offensive remarks towards fellow actor James Hong.

BB 17's Ayesha Khan faints while shooting, video goes viralBigg Boss 17 fae Ayesha Khan fainted on the sets of her upcoming project. Reportedly, the incident took place on Kapil Sharma's Kis Kisko Pyaar Karun set.

Nora Fatehi, Jason Durelo teach Kelly Clarkson Snake hook step. WatchKelly Clarkson welcomed Nora Fatehi and Jason Derulo on her talk show, where they showcased their latest hit, Snake, and even taught Kelly the hook step.

Lisa Kudrow's No Good Deed: This dark comedy could have been darker and funnierLisa Kudrow and Ray Romano are beloved comedic actors. And they deserved better treatment than Netflix's No Good Deed, which is fine at best. The series is currently streaming on the OTT platform.

With Love, Meghan review: You are neither fancy nor rich enough for Markle's show Released-Wed Mar 05, 2025With Love, Meghan could have been a lovely show about cooking and lifestyle, but it becomes a window into Markle's pretentiousness. It can't do away with its elitism, the one thing that Markle stood against during her stint at the royal palace.

Netflix cancels Noah Centineo-led The Recruit after 2 seasonsStreaming giant Netflix has cancelled actor Noah Centineo-starrer The Recruit after only two seasons. The news was recently confirmed by the OTT platform.

Daredevil Born Again review: An uneven but triumphant return of Hell's Kitchen's devilReleased-Wed Mar 05, 2025Matt Murdock is back as Hell's Kitchen's favourite vigilante in Marvel Studios' Daredevil Born Again. The show had its two-episode premiere on March 5 and can be streamed on JioHotstar.

Ali Fazal trains 7 hours a day for Rakht Brahmand, learns ancient martial artsAli Fazal undergoes 7-hour daily training, learning martial arts and perfecting diction for Rakht Brahmand. He calls the process "demanding but rewarding." The series also stars Samantha Ruth Prabhu.
Bigg Boss 17's Anurag Dobhal gets engaged to girlfriend RitikaBigg Boss 17's Anurag Dobhal got engaged to his girlfriend Ritika Chauhan. The vlogger shared pictures on Instagram on March 5.

Madhavan, Nayanthara, Siddharth's Netflix film Test to premiere on April 4Madhavan, Nayanthara, and Siddharth star in Test, a Tamil Netflix film exploring life's biggest challenges beyond cricket. Directed by S. Sashikanth, it will stream from April 4.

Liam Payne's girlfriend breaks down remembering singer, says 'can't fully accept'One Direction singer Liam Payne's untimely demise has left his girlfriend Kate Cassidy grappling with grief. In a heartfelt interview, she talked about her struggles and healing journey.

Actor Parambrata jokes about playing a cop ahead of Khakee: The Bengal ChapterActor Parambrata Chattopadhyay recently joked about playing a police officer ahead of his Netflix series, Khakee: The Bengal Chapter. The actor even shared reasons behind nodding to feature in the political drama.

Khakee The Bengal Chapter trailer: Neeraj Pandey show dives into politics, crimeThe trailer for Khakee The Bengal Chapter was unveiled on March 5. The show promises a riveting series filled with action, drama, and political intrigue.

general news.headline: Despicable act: India condemns vandalism at Hindu temple in CaliforniaThis latest incident comes less than five months after the BAPS Shri Swaminarayan Mandir in California state capital Sacramento was desecrated with anti-Hindu messages.

Sorry Shinde saheb: BMW driver's apology after urinating at Pune traffic stopGaurav Ahuja, caught on video urinating at a Pune traffic stop, recorded an apology before his detention, vowing never to repeat the act.

Journalist killed in UP's Sitapur: Bike hit, then shot three times on highwayReportedly, the incident happened when the assailants first rammed into his bike and then shot him three times. It was first seen as an accident but was soon turned into a murder case after doctors at a district hospital discovered three bullet wounds on his body.

Harsh Goenka's 'few bright IITians' comment on Bengaluru's 'progress' sparks debateIn a now-viral post on X, Harsh Goenka shared a photo of Narayana Murthy and Nandan Nilekani as he reflected on how the city had evolved from a "peaceful haven" into a gridlocked metropolis.

Udta Kerala: How state's drug crisis could be worse than Punjab'sKerala thwarted the tide of narcotics even as drug abuse surged globally at various points in history. However, the southern state is now dealing with a drug crisis that seems to be worse than Punjab's. God's Own Country has seen a scary surge in drug-fuelled violence, as synthetic drugs breach the walls of its schools and destroy homes.

India's tariff cuts align with past trade pacts, not Trump pressure: SourcesAccording to sources, the development is seen as part of India's move to significantly reduce its average applied tariffs to key developed countries like Australia, the United Arab Emirates, Switzerland and Norway under a series of recently-concluded bilateral trade agreements.

Work together: Mallikarjun Kharge to Siddaramaiah, DK Shivakumar amid rift buzzSpeculation has been rife about a potential leadership change in Karnataka towards the end of this year under a "rotational chief minister" or "power-sharing" arrangement. Shivakumar, who is also the state Congress chief, is being viewed as a strong Chief Ministerial aspirant.

US judge holds China liable for Covid-19 cover-up, orders to pay $24 billionCases of the novel coronavirus were first detected in China in December 2019. As of February 2025, there have been 7,087,718 confirmed Covid-19 deaths across the globe, making it the fifth-deadliest pandemic or epidemic in history.
More than 50% of women explore adventure travel after 45: SurveyA new survey reveals a remarkable shift in the way women travel and the things that are now non-negotiable for them.

J&K government under fire for land given 'free of cost' to ex-Sri Lanka cricketerAccording to reports, former Sri Lankan cricketer Muttiah Muralitharan's company, Ceylon Beverages, has been allotted 25.75 acres for a Rs 1,600 crore bottle-filling and aluminium can-manufacturing unit in Kathua district.

Gaza not for sale: Trump's Scotland golf resort vandalised over 'takeover' planPro-Palestinian activists vandalised Donald Trump's Turnberry golf resort in Scotland, with Palestine Action claiming it was a response to his remarks on taking control of and redeveloping Gaza.

Video: Railway cop saves woman dragged by moving train at Mumbai's Borivali stationA video of a railway cop saving a woman dragged by a moving train at Mumbai's Borivali station went viral on social media.

4 Gujarat medical college students kidnap, thrash juniors over spat; suspendedAccording to the police complaint, the three junior doctors said that during the convocation of the 2019 batch, two groups of students were divided and, since then, there has been a rift.

Karan Johar opens up about his weight-loss journeyFilmmaker Karan Johar recently opened up about his transformation at the ongoing IIFA event in Jaipur. The director-producer emphasised that it is all about taking care of yourself.

Bihar Police crackdown on 'vulgar' Bhojpuri songs: Burning social problemThe Bihar Police has launched a crackdown on double-meaning Bhojpuri songs in public, calling it a "burning social problem" that threatens women's safety and harms children's minds.

Watch: Thick wildfire smoke engulfs New York's Long Island, emergency declaredNew York state Governor Kathy Hochul has declared a state of emergency and said state agencies were responding to the fires around the Pine Barrens area east of New York City. Homes, a chemical factory and an Amazon warehouse were at risk  from the fast-moving wildfire.

Woman recreates Aishwarya-Abhishek's Tere Bina scene with husband in viral videoA video of a woman recreating iconic scenes from the 'Tere Bina' song of 'Guru' with her husband has delighted the internet. It is easy to see why it's viral.

Hampi horror: 2 arrested for rape of tourist, homestay host, hunt on for thirdKarnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah condemned the gang-rape of two women, including an Israeli tourist, in Koppal and assured strict action. Police have arrested two suspects and are searching for the third

SRK, Madhuri rehearse Koi Ladki Hai for IIFA 2025, fans relive 90s nostalgiaShah Rukh Khan and Madhuri Dixit are set to enthrall fans with their performance together at the International Indian Film Academy (IIFA) 2025. The two will be dancing together on their track, Koi Ladki Hai.

Google employees get to nap after meals: Video gives a glimpse of Gurugram officeIn a now-viral video, a woman offered a glimpse of what life looks like inside Google's Gurugram office. The video has left social media users impressed.

Over 1,000 killed in 2 days of clashes between Syrian forces and Assad loyalistsThe Britain-based Syrian Observatory for Human Rights said in addition to 745 civilians killed, mostly in shootings from close distance, 125 government security force members and 148 militants with armed groups affiliated with Assad were killed.

Airplane mode on: Ranbir Kapoor sweats it out for Love and WarBollywood star Ranbir Kapoor is leaving no stone unturned in his training for Sanjay Leela Bhansali's Love and War. The film also stars Vicky Kaushal and Alia Bhatt in pivotal roles.

sports.headline: India vs New Zealand Champions Trophy Final: Full Scorecard IND vs NZ Scorecard, Champions Trophy Final Match 2025: Rohit Sharma-led India and Mitchell Santner's New Zealand will go head-to-head in the big final in Dubai today. Here's the full live scorecard of the big final.

Rohit Sharma loses toss again, ties Brian Lara's unwanted recordRohit Sharma has found himself once again on the wrong side of the toss as New Zealand won the coin flip and will bat first in the Champions Trophy 2025. Rohit tied Brian Lara's record of lossing 12 tosses on the trot.

India avoid Matt Henry threat after New Zealand pacer misses out on finalNew Zealand suffered a major setback before the Champions Trophy Final as pacer Matt Henry was ruled out due to a shoulder injury. His absence leaves the Black Caps vulnerable against India's powerful batting lineup in Dubai.

Deep Dasgupta explainsDeep Dasgupta feels that the legacy of Rohit Sharma has been the way he has changed the perception of white-ball cricket in India in the past few years with his aggressive approach. Novak Djokovic slumps to yet another first-round exit after shock defeatIndian Wells 2025: Former World No.1 Novak Djokovic failed to go through to the second round after Botic van de Zandschulp of the Netherlands defeated the Serb 6-2, 3-6, 6-1.

Yes, Rohit Sharma has lost the toss again. New Zealand have opted to bat first. They will miss senior pacer Matt Henry, who is out with an injury. Regardless of what happens in the Champions Trophy final, Rohit deserves to carry on until the 2027 World Cup. However, if he decides to step away, he can do so knowing that his vision will endure.

Barcelona vs Osasuna postponed minutes before kickoff after first team staff diesFC Barcelona vs Osasuna was postponed at the last minute after Barcelona's first team doctor died in the afternoon. Both teams had announced their line-ups and were warming up before the game was called off.

WPL: Royal Challengers Bengaluru face early exit after 12-run loss vs UP WarriorzRoyal Challengers Bengaluru got knocked out of the Women's Premier League 2025 following their 12-run loss against UP Warriorz in Match 18. RCB are languishing on the last spot on the points table with two wins from seven matches.

Santner confirmed that the team would be watching the replays very closely before the summit clash.

Suryakumar Yadav jokes about heated face-off with Virat Kohli from IPL 2020Star India batter Suryakumar Yadav recalled his heated face-off with Virat Kohli from the Indian Premier League 2020. Suryakumar played a match-winning innings of 79* (43) for Mumbai Indians (MI) against Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) during Match 48 of the season and even had a heated moment with Kohli during his innings.

Mitchell Santner ready for an all-out spin battle to become 3rd time lucky vs IndiaNew Zealand captain Mitchell Santner is ready for the spin challenge against India in the all-important final of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 on Sunday, March 9. Ajit Agarkar to discuss Rohit Sharma's future after Champions Trophy finalChief selector Ajit Agarkar is set to meet India captain Rohit Sharma after the conclusion of the Champions Trophy.  According to sources privy to the matter, they are going to discuss Rohit's future in the ODI team.

T20 World Cup victory broke the jinx, we're now hungry to win more: Shubman GillIndia vice captain Shubman Gill said that the T20 World Cup 2024 victory broke the knockout jinx of the team, and they are now they're hungry to add more titles to their cabinet. India are set to lock horns in the final of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 against New Zealand on Sunday, March 9 in Dubai.

I watch my T20 World Cup 2024 final catch every day: Suryakumar YadavIndia's T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav revealed that he watches his T20 World Cup catch every day. Suryakumar Yadav took a sensational catch at long off in the final to help India beat South Africa and clinch their second T20 World Cup title.

IPL or PSL? Mumbai Indians new man Corbin Bosch signs up for both leaguesMumbai Indians' new man Corbin Bosch finds himself in a tricky spot as the South African all-rounder has signed up for the IPL 2025 and PSL 2025. Bosch came in as a replacement signing for MI.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
